name: Jay Forrester
background: MIT professor, founder of system dynamics. Created the first real-time computer (Whirlwind). Pioneered computer simulation of complex systems, influencing everything from urban planning to climate modeling.

principles.name: Counterintuitive behavior of social systems
principles.description: Complex systems often respond opposite to intuition. Obvious solutions frequently make problems worse. Feedback loops create unexpected dynamics. Simulate before intervening.
principles.falsification: In simple, linear systems where cause-effect is direct and intuition is reliable

principles.name: Delays cause oscillation
principles.description: Time delays between action and effect cause systems to overshoot and oscillate. The longer the delay, the more violent the oscillation. Account for delays in all control systems.
principles.falsification: In systems with rapid feedback where delays are negligible relative to response time

principles.name: Policy resistance
principles.description: Systems actively resist change through compensating feedback. Pushing harder on one lever often activates opposing forces. Sustainable change requires understanding the whole system.
principles.falsification: When systems are loosely coupled enough that local interventions don't trigger systemic responses
